glsa.title: KDirStat: Arbitrary command execution
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in KDirStat could allow local attackers to execute arbitrary shell commands.

background.p: KDirStat is a graphical disk usage utility for KDE.

description.p: Missing escape of executable shell command in KDirStat can be used to insert malicious shell commands.

impact.p: A local attacker could possibly execute arbitrary shell command with the privileges of the process.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All KDirStat users should upgrade to the latest version:
